   20: 
   21: -module(code_SUITE).
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23:          versions/1,new_binary_types/1,
   24:          bad_beam_file/1,
   25:          literal_leak/1,
   26:          call_purged_fun_code_gone/1,
   27:          call_purged_fun_code_reload/1,
   28:          call_purged_fun_code_there/1,
   29:          call_purged_fun_code_altered/1,
   30:          multi_proc_purge/1, t_check_old_code/1,
   31:          many_purges/1,
   32:          external_fun/1,get_chunk/1,module_md5/1,
   33:          constant_pools/1,constant_refc_binaries/1,
   34:          fake_literals/1,
   35:          false_dependency/1,coverage/1,fun_confusion/1,
   36:          t_copy_literals/1, t_copy_literals_frags/1,
   37:          erl_544/1, max_heap_size/1,
   38:          check_process_code_signal_order/1,
   39:          check_process_code_dirty_exec_proc/1,
   40:          call_fun_before_load/1]).
   41: 
   42: -define(line_trace, 1).
   43: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   44: 
   45: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   46: 
   47: all() ->
   48:     [versions, new_binary_types,
   49:      bad_beam_file, literal_leak,
   50:      call_purged_fun_code_gone,
   51:      call_purged_fun_code_reload, call_purged_fun_code_there,
   52:      call_purged_fun_code_altered,
   53:      multi_proc_purge, t_check_old_code, external_fun, get_chunk,
   54:      module_md5, many_purges,
   55:      constant_pools, constant_refc_binaries, fake_literals,
   56:      false_dependency,
   57:      coverage, fun_confusion, t_copy_literals, t_copy_literals_frags,
   58:      erl_544, max_heap_size, check_process_code_signal_order,
   59:      check_process_code_dirty_exec_proc, call_fun_before_load].
   60: 
   61: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   62:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   66:     catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
   67:     ok.
   68: 
   69: %% Make sure that only two versions of a module can be loaded.
   70: versions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   71:     V1 = compile_version(1, Config),
   72:     V2 = compile_version(2, Config),
   73:     V3 = compile_version(3, Config),
   74: 
   75:     {ok,P1,1} = load_version(V1, 1),
   76:     {ok,P2,2} = load_version(V2, 2),
   77:     {error,not_purged} = load_version(V2, 2),
   78:     {error,not_purged} = load_version(V3, 3),
   79: 
   80:     1 = check_version(P1),
   81:     2 = check_version(P2),
   82:     2 = versions:version(),
   83: 
   84:     %% Kill processes, unload code.
   85:     _ = monitor(process, P1),
   86:     _ = monitor(process, P2),
   87:     P1 ! P2 ! done,
   88:     receive
   89:         {'DOWN',_,process,P1,normal} -> ok
   90:     end,
   91:     receive
   92:         {'DOWN',_,process,P2,normal} -> ok
   93:     end,
   94:     true = erlang:purge_module(versions),
   95:     true = erlang:delete_module(versions),
   96:     true = erlang:purge_module(versions),
   97:     ok.
   98: 
   99: compile_version(Version, Config) ->
  100:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  101:     File = filename:join(Data, "versions"),
  102:     {ok,versions,Bin} = compile:file(File, [{d,'VERSION',Version},
  103:                                             binary,report]),
  104:     Bin.
  105: 
  106: load_version(Code, Ver) ->
  107:     case erlang:load_module(versions, Code) of
  108:         {module,versions} ->
  109:             Pid = spawn_link(versions, loop, []),
  110:             Ver = versions:version(),
  111:             Ver = check_version(Pid),
  112:             {ok,Pid,Ver};
  113:         Error ->
  114:             Error
  115:     end.
  116: 
  117: check_version(Pid) ->
  118:     Pid ! {self(),version},
  119:     receive
  120:         {Pid,version,Version} ->
  121:             Version
  122:     end.
  123: 
  124: new_binary_types(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  125:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  126:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  127:     {ok,my_code_test,Bin} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  128:     {module,my_code_test} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  129:                                                make_sub_binary(Bin)),
  130:     true = erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  131:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  132: 
  133:     {module,my_code_test} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  134:                                                make_unaligned_sub_binary(Bin)),
  135:     true = erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  136:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  137: 
  138:     %% Try heap binaries and bad binaries.
  139:     {error,badfile} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test, <<1,2>>),
  140:     {error,badfile} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  141:                                          make_sub_binary(<<1,2>>)),
  142:     {error,badfile} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  143:                                          make_unaligned_sub_binary(<<1,2>>)),
  144:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  145:                                                     bit_sized_binary(Bin))),
  146:     ok.
  147: 
  148: %% Ensure that the loader doesn't crash or leak memory when attempting
  149: %% to load bad BEAM files. We depend on valgrind to notice leaks.
  150: bad_beam_file(_Config) ->
  151:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  152: 
  153:     BadBeam1 = bad_beam_file_1(Mod),
  154:     {error,badfile} = code:load_binary(Mod, atom_to_list(Mod), BadBeam1),
  155: 
  156:     BadBeam2 = bad_beam_file_2(Mod),
  157:     {error,badfile} = code:load_binary(Mod, atom_to_list(Mod), BadBeam2),
  158: 
  159:     ok.
  160: 
  161: %% Build a BEAM file with an invalid instruction in the code chunk.
  162: bad_beam_file_1(Mod) ->
  163:     Exp = [{term,0}],
  164:     Attr = [],
  165:     Fs = [{function,term,0,3,
  166:            [{label,1},
  167:             {line,[]},
  168:             {func_info,{atom,Mod},{atom,term},0},
  169:             {label,2},
  170:             {move,nil,nil},                     %Illegal destination.
  171:             return]}],
  172:     Asm = {Mod,Exp,Attr,Fs,3},
  173: 
  174:     %% Bypass beam_validator.
  175:     {ok,BadBeam} = beam_asm:module(Asm, [], [], []),
  176:     BadBeam.
  177: 
  178: %% Build a BEAM file with an invalid attributes chunk.
  179: bad_beam_file_2(Mod) ->
  180:     Asm = {Mod,[],[],[],1},
  181:     {ok,BadBeam0} = beam_asm:module(Asm, [], [], []),
  182:     {ok, Mod, Chunks0} = beam_lib:all_chunks(BadBeam0),
  183:     Chunks1 = lists:keydelete("Attr", 1, Chunks0),
  184:     Chunks = [{"Attr",<<"bad_attribute_chunk">>} | Chunks1],
  185:     {ok,BadBeam} = beam_lib:build_module(Chunks),
  186:     BadBeam.
  187: 
  188: %% Ensure that literal areas don't leak when erlang:prepare_loading/2
  189: %% is not followed by erlang:finish_loading/1.
  190: literal_leak(_Config) ->
  191:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  192:     HugeLiteral = binary_to_list(<<0:(1024*1024)/unit:8>>),
  193:     Exp = [{term,0}],
  194:     Attr = [],
  195:     Fs = [{function,term,0,3,
  196:            [{label,1},
  197:             {line,[]},
  198:             {func_info,{atom,Mod},{atom,term},0},
  199:             {label,2},
  200:             {move,{literal,HugeLiteral},{x,0}},
  201:             return]}],
  202:     Asm = {Mod,Exp,Attr,Fs,3},
  203:     {ok,Beam} = beam_asm:module(Asm, [], [], []),
  204: 
  205:     %% valgrind cannot help us find leak of literals because literal
  206:     %% areas are allocated using mmap().
  207:     %%
  208:     %% Instead we will prepare for loading a BEAM file with a 16Mb
  209:     %% literal N times so that the reserved literal memory range will
  210:     %% overflow.
  211:     %%
  212:     %% Setting N to 64 is sufficient for overflowing a 1 GB literal
  213:     %% area (which is the size at the time of writing). Just to be
  214:     %% sure, we will go a little bit higher...
  215: 
  216:     N = 128,
  217:     _ = [begin
  218:              _ = erlang:prepare_loading(Mod, Beam),
  219:              _ = erlang:garbage_collect()
  220:          end || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
  221:     ok.
  222: 
  223: call_purged_fun_code_gone(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  224:     run_sys_proc_test(fun call_purged_fun_code_gone_test/1, Config).
  225: 
  226: call_purged_fun_code_gone_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  227:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  228:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  229:     call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, code_gone),
  230:     ok.
  231: 
  232: call_purged_fun_code_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  233:     run_sys_proc_test(fun call_purged_fun_code_reload_test/1, Config).
  234: 
  235: call_purged_fun_code_reload_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  236:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  237:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  238:     Path = code:get_path(),
  239:     true = code:add_path(Priv),
  240:     try
  241: 	call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, code_reload)
  242:     after
  243: 	code:set_path(Path)
  244:     end,
  245:     ok.
  246: 
  247: call_purged_fun_code_there(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  248:     run_sys_proc_test(fun call_purged_fun_code_there_test/1, Config).
  249: 
  250: call_purged_fun_code_there_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  251:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  252:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  253:     call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, code_there),
  254:     ok.
  255: 
  256: %% GH-7288: calling a fun defined by a module that had been purged after
  257: %% loading a different version of the same module (and therefore did not
  258: %% inherit the old fun entries) could cause the emulator to crash.
  259: call_purged_fun_code_altered(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  260:     run_sys_proc_test(fun call_purged_fun_code_altered_test/1, Config).
  261: 
  262: call_purged_fun_code_altered_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  263:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  264:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  265:     call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, code_altered),
  266:     ok.
  267: 
  268: call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, Type) ->
  269:     SrcFile = filename:join(Data, "call_purged_fun_tester.erl"),
  270:     ObjFile = filename:join(Priv, "call_purged_fun_tester.beam"),
  271:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(SrcFile, [binary, report]),
  272:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, ObjFile, Code),
  273: 
  274:     call_purged_fun_tester:do(Priv, Data, Type, []).
  275: 
  276: multi_proc_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  277:     run_sys_proc_test(fun multi_proc_purge_test/1, Config).
  278: 
  279: multi_proc_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  280:     %%
  281:     %% Make sure purge requests aren't lost when
  282:     %% purger process is working.
  283:     %%
  284:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  285:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  286:     File1 = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  287:     File2 = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test2"),
  288:     
  289:     {ok,my_code_test} = c:c(File1, [{outdir,Priv}]),
  290:     {ok,my_code_test2} = c:c(File2, [{outdir,Priv}]),
  291:     erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  292:     erlang:delete_module(my_code_test2),
  293: 
  294:     Self = self(),
  295: 
  296:     Fun1 = fun () ->
  297: 		   erts_code_purger:purge(my_code_test),
  298: 		   Self ! {self(), done}
  299: 	   end,
  300:     Fun2 = fun () ->
  301: 		   erts_code_purger:soft_purge(my_code_test2),
  302: 		   Self ! {self(), done}
  303: 	   end,
  304:     Fun3 = fun () ->
  305: 		   erts_code_purger:purge('__nonexisting_module__'),
  306: 		   Self ! {self(), done}
  307: 	   end,
  308:     Fun4 = fun () ->
  309: 		   erts_code_purger:soft_purge('__another_nonexisting_module__'),
  310: 		   Self ! {self(), done}
  311: 	   end,
  312: 
  313:     Pid1 = spawn_link(Fun1),
  314:     Pid2 = spawn_link(Fun2),
  315:     Pid3 = spawn_link(Fun3),
  316:     Pid4 = spawn_link(Fun4),
  317:     Pid5 = spawn_link(Fun1),
  318:     Pid6 = spawn_link(Fun2),
  319:     Pid7 = spawn_link(Fun3),
  320:     receive after 50 -> ok end,
  321:     Pid8 = spawn_link(Fun4),
  322:     Pid9 = spawn_link(Fun1),
  323:     Pid10 = spawn_link(Fun2),
  324:     Pid11 = spawn_link(Fun3),
  325:     Pid12 = spawn_link(Fun4),
  326:     Pid13 = spawn_link(Fun1),
  327:     receive after 50 -> ok end,
  328:     Pid14 = spawn_link(Fun2),
  329:     Pid15 = spawn_link(Fun3),
  330:     Pid16 = spawn_link(Fun4),
  331: 
  332:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> receive {P, done} -> ok end end,
  333: 		  [Pid1, Pid2, Pid3, Pid4, Pid5, Pid6, Pid7, Pid8,
  334: 		   Pid9, Pid10, Pid11, Pid12, Pid13, Pid14, Pid15, Pid16]),
  335:     ok.
  336: 
  337: %% Test the erlang:check_old_code/1 BIF.
  338: t_check_old_code(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  339:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  340:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  341: 
  342:     catch erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  343:     catch erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  344:     catch erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  345: 
  346:     false = erlang:check_old_code(my_code_test),
  347: 
  348:     {ok,my_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  349:     {module,my_code_test} = code:load_binary(my_code_test, File, Code),
  350: 
  351:     false = erlang:check_old_code(my_code_test),
  352:     {module,my_code_test} = code:load_binary(my_code_test, File, Code),
  353:     true = erlang:check_old_code(my_code_test),
  354: 
  355:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  356:     true = erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  357:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  358: 
  359:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch erlang:check_old_code([])),
  360: 
  361:     ok.
  362: 
  363: many_purges(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  364:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  365:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  366: 
  367:     catch erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  368:     catch erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  369:     catch erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  370:     {ok,my_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  371: 
  372:     ct:log("Process count: ~p~n", [erlang:system_info(process_count)]),
  373: 
  374:     many_purges_test(File, Code, 1000),
  375: 
  376:     Rand = fun Rand() ->
  377:                    _ = lists:seq(1, rand:uniform(100)),
  378:                    receive after rand:uniform(10) -> ok end,
  379:                    Rand()
  380:            end,
  381:     Ps0 = lists:map(fun (_) -> spawn(Rand) end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
  382: 
  383:     ct:log("Process count: ~p~n", [erlang:system_info(process_count)]),
  384: 
  385:     many_purges_test(File, Code, 1000),
  386: 
  387:     Ps1 = lists:map(fun (_) -> spawn(Rand) end, lists:seq(1, 1000)),
  388: 
  389:     ct:log("Process count: ~p~n", [erlang:system_info(process_count)]),
  390: 
  391:     many_purges_test(File, Code, 1000),
  392: 
  393:     Ps = Ps0 ++ Ps1,
  394: 
  395:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> exit(P, kill) end, Ps),
  396:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> false = is_process_alive(P) end, Ps),
  397: 
  398:     ok.
  399: 
  400: many_purges_test(_File, _Code, 0) ->
  401:     ok;
  402: many_purges_test(File, Code, N) ->
  403:     {module,my_code_test} = code:load_binary(my_code_test, File, Code),
  404:     true = erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  405:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  406:     many_purges_test(File, Code, N-1).
  407: 
  408: external_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  409:     false = erlang:function_exported(another_code_test, x, 1),
  410:     AnotherCodeTest = id(another_code_test),
  411:     ExtFun = fun AnotherCodeTest:x/1,
  412:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch ExtFun(answer)),
  413:     false = erlang:function_exported(another_code_test, x, 1),
  414:     false = lists:member(another_code_test, erlang:loaded()),
  415:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  416:     File = filename:join(Data, "another_code_test"),
  417:     {ok,another_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary,report]),
  418:     {module,another_code_test} = erlang:load_module(another_code_test, Code),
  419:     42 = ExtFun(answer),
  420:     ok.
  421: 
  422: get_chunk(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  423:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  424:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  425:     {ok,my_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  426: 
  427:     %% Should work.
  428:     Chunk = get_chunk_ok("AtU8", Code),
  429:     Chunk = get_chunk_ok("AtU8", make_sub_binary(Code)),
  430:     Chunk = get_chunk_ok("AtU8", make_unaligned_sub_binary(Code)),
  431: 
  432:     %% Should fail.
  433:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch code:get_chunk(bit_sized_binary(Code), "AtU8")),
  434:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch code:get_chunk(Code, "bad chunk id")),
  435: 
  436:     %% Invalid beam code or missing chunk should return 'undefined'.
  437:     undefined = code:get_chunk(<<"not a beam module">>, "AtU8"),
  438:     undefined = code:get_chunk(Code, "XXXX"),
  439: 
  440:     ok.
  441: 
  442: get_chunk_ok(Chunk, Code) ->
  443:     case code:get_chunk(Code, Chunk) of
  444:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) -> Bin
  445:     end.
  446: 
  447: module_md5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  448:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  449:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  450:     {ok,my_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  451: 
  452:     %% Should work.
  453:     Chunk = module_md5_ok(Code),
  454:     Chunk = module_md5_ok(make_sub_binary(Code)),
  455:     Chunk = module_md5_ok(make_unaligned_sub_binary(Code)),
  456: 
  457:     %% Should fail.
  458:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch code:module_md5(bit_sized_binary(Code))),
  459: 
  460:     %% Invalid beam code should return 'undefined'.
  461:     undefined = code:module_md5(<<"not a beam module">>),
  462:     ok.
  463: 
  464: module_md5_ok(Code) ->
  465:     case code:module_md5(Code) of
  466:         Bin when is_binary(Bin), size(Bin) =:= 16 -> Bin
  467:     end.
  468: 
  469: 
  470: constant_pools(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  471:     run_sys_proc_test(fun constant_pools_test/1, Config).
  472: 
  473: constant_pools_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  474:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  475:     File = filename:join(Data, "literals"),
  476:     {ok,literals,Code} = compile:file(File, [report,binary]),
  477:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals,
  478:                                            make_sub_binary(Code)),
  479: 
  480:     %% Initialize.
  481:     A = literals:a(),
  482:     B = literals:b(),
  483:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  484:     D = literals:funs(),
  485:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  486:     Self = self(),
  487: 
  488:     %% Have a process WITHOUT old heap that references the literals
  489:     %% in the 'literals' module.
  490:     NoOldHeap = spawn_link(fun() -> no_old_heap(Self) end),
  491:     receive go -> ok end,
  492:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  493:     false = erlang:check_process_code(NoOldHeap, literals),
  494:     erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  495:     true = erlang:purge_module(literals),
  496:     NoOldHeap ! done,
  497:     receive
  498:         {'EXIT',NoOldHeap,{A,B,C,D}} ->
  499:             ok;
  500:         Other_NoOldHeap ->
  501:             ct:fail({unexpected,Other_NoOldHeap})
  502:     end,
  503:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  504: 
  505:     %% Have a process with an inconsistent heap (legal while GC is disabled)
  506:     %% that references the literals in the 'literals' module.
  507:     InconsistentHeap = spawn_link(fun() -> inconsistent_heap(Self) end),
  508:     receive go -> ok end,
  509:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  510:     false = erlang:check_process_code(InconsistentHeap, literals),
  511:     erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  512:     true = erlang:purge_module(literals),
  513:     InconsistentHeap ! done,
  514:     receive
  515:         {'EXIT',InconsistentHeap,{A,B,C}} ->
  516:             ok;
  517:         Other_InconsistentHeap ->
  518:             ct:fail({unexpected,Other_InconsistentHeap})
  519:     end,
  520:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  521: 
  522:     %% Have a process WITH an old heap that references the literals
  523:     %% in the 'literals' module.
  524:     OldHeap = spawn_link(fun() -> old_heap(Self) end),
  525:     receive go -> ok end,
  526:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  527:     false = erlang:check_process_code(OldHeap, literals),
  528:     erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  529:     erlang:purge_module(literals),
  530:     OldHeap ! done,
  531:     receive
  532: 	{'EXIT',OldHeap,{A,B,C,D,[1,2,3|_]=Seq}} when length(Seq) =:= 16 ->
  533: 	    ok
  534:     end,
  535: 
  536:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  537:     %% Have a hibernated process that references the literals
  538:     %% in the 'literals' module.
  539:     {Hib, Mon} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> hibernated(Self) end),
  540:     receive go -> ok end,
  541:     [{heap_size,OldHeapSz},
  542:      {total_heap_size,OldTotHeapSz}] = process_info(Hib, [heap_size,
  543: 							  total_heap_size]),
  544:     OldHeapSz = OldTotHeapSz,
  545:     io:format("OldHeapSz=~p OldTotHeapSz=~p~n", [OldHeapSz, OldTotHeapSz]),
  546:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  547:     false = erlang:check_process_code(Hib, literals),
  548:     erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  549:     erlang:purge_module(literals),
  550:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  551:     [{heap_size,HeapSz},
  552:      {total_heap_size,TotHeapSz}] = process_info(Hib, [heap_size,
  553: 						       total_heap_size]),
  554:     io:format("HeapSz=~p TotHeapSz=~p~n", [HeapSz, TotHeapSz]),
  555:     Hib ! hej,
  556:     receive
  557: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Hib, Reason} ->
  558: 	    {undef, [{no_module,
  559: 		      no_function,
  560: 		      [{A,B,C,D,[1,2,3|_]=Seq}], _}]} = Reason,
  561: 	    16 = length(Seq)
  562:     end,
  563:     HeapSz = TotHeapSz, %% Ensure restored to hibernated state...
  564:     true = HeapSz > OldHeapSz,
  565:     ok.
  566: 
  567: no_old_heap(Parent) ->
  568:     A = literals:a(),
  569:     B = literals:b(),
  570:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  571:     D = literals:funs(),
  572:     Res = {A,B,C,D},
  573:     Parent ! go,
  574:     receive
  575:         done ->
  576:             exit(Res)
  577:     end.
  578: 
  579: old_heap(Parent) ->
  580:     A = literals:a(),
  581:     B = literals:b(),
  582:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  583:     D = literals:funs(),
  584:     Res = {A,B,C,D,lists:seq(1, 16)},
  585:     create_old_heap(),
  586:     Parent ! go,
  587:     receive
  588:         done ->
  589:             exit(Res)
  590:     end.
  591: 
  592: inconsistent_heap(Parent) ->
  593:     A = literals:a(),
  594:     B = literals:b(),
  595:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  596:     Res = {A,B,C},
  597:     Parent ! go,
  598: 
  599:     %% Disable the GC and return a tuple whose arity and contents are broken
  600:     BrokenTerm = erts_debug:set_internal_state(inconsistent_heap, start),
  601:     receive
  602:     after 5000 ->
  603:         %% Fix the tuple and enable the GC again
  604:         ok = erts_debug:set_internal_state(inconsistent_heap, BrokenTerm),
  605:         erlang:garbage_collect()
  606:     end,
  607: 
  608:     receive
  609:         done ->
  610:             exit(Res)
  611:     end.
  612: 
  613: hibernated(Parent) ->
  614:     A = literals:a(),
  615:     B = literals:b(),
  616:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  617:     D = literals:funs(),
  618:     Res = {A,B,C,D,lists:seq(1, 16)},
  619:     Parent ! go,
  620:     erlang:hibernate(no_module, no_function, [Res]).
  621: 
  622: create_old_heap() ->
  623:     case process_info(self(), [heap_size,total_heap_size]) of
  624:         [{heap_size,Sz},{total_heap_size,Total}] when Sz < Total ->
  625:             ok;
  626:         _ ->
  627:             create_old_heap()
  628:     end.
  629: 
  630: constant_refc_binaries(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  631:     run_sys_proc_test(fun constant_refc_binaries_test/1, Config).
  632: 
  633: constant_refc_binaries_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  634:     wait_for_memory_deallocations(),
  635:     Bef = memory_binary(),
  636:     io:format("Binary data (bytes) before test: ~p\n", [Bef]),
  637: 
  638:     %% Compile the literals module.
  639:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  640:     File = filename:join(Data, "literals"),
  641:     {ok,literals,Code} = compile:file(File, [report,binary]),
  642: 
  643:     %% Load the code and make sure that the binary is a refc binary.
  644:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  645:     Bin = literals:binary(),
  646:     Sz = byte_size(Bin),
  647:     Check = erlang:md5(Bin),
  648:     io:format("Size of literal refc binary: ~p\n", [Sz]),
  649:     {refc_binary,Sz,_,_} = erts_debug:get_internal_state({binary_info,Bin}),
  650:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  651:     false = erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  652:     true = erlang:purge_module(literals),
  653: 
  654:     %% Now try to provoke a memory leak.
  655:     provoke_mem_leak(10, Code, Check),
  656: 
  657:     %% Calculate the change in allocated binary data.
  658:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  659:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  660:     wait_for_memory_deallocations(),
  661:     Aft = memory_binary(),
  662:     io:format("Binary data (bytes) after test: ~p", [Aft]),
  663:     Diff = Aft - Bef,
  664:     if
  665:         Diff < 0 ->
  666:             io:format("~p less bytes", [abs(Diff)]);
  667:         Diff > 0 ->
  668:             io:format("~p more bytes", [Diff]);
  669:         true ->
  670:             ok
  671:     end,
  672: 
  673:     %% Test for leaks. We must accept some natural variations in
  674:     %% the size of allocated binaries.
  675:     if
  676:         Diff > 64*1024 ->
  677:             ct:fail(binary_leak);
  678:         true ->
  679:             ok
  680:     end.
  681: 
  682: memory_binary() ->
  683:     try
  684:         erlang:memory(binary)
  685:     catch
  686:         error:notsup ->
  687:             0
  688:     end.
  689: 
  690: provoke_mem_leak(0, _, _) -> ok;
  691: provoke_mem_leak(N, Code, Check) ->
  692:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  693: 
  694:     %% Create several processes with references to the literal binary.
  695:     Self = self(),
  696:     Pids = [spawn_link(fun() ->
  697:                                create_binaries(Self, NumRefs, Check)
  698:                        end) || NumRefs <- lists:seq(1, 10)],
  699:     [receive {started,Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  700: 
  701:     %% Make the code old and remove references to the constant pool
  702:     %% in all processes.
  703:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  704:     Ms = [spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  705:                                 false = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, literals)
  706:                         end) || Pid <- Pids],
  707:     [receive
  708:          {'DOWN',R,process,P,normal} ->
  709:              ok
  710:      end || {P,R} <- Ms],
  711: 
  712:     %% Purge the code.
  713:     true = erlang:purge_module(literals),
  714: 
  715:     %% Tell the processes that the code has been purged.
  716:     [begin
  717:          monitor(process, Pid),
  718:          Pid ! purged
  719:      end || Pid <- Pids],
  720: 
  721:     %% Wait for all processes to terminate.
  722:     [receive
  723:          {'DOWN',_,process,Pid,normal} ->
  724:              ok
  725:      end || Pid <- Pids],
  726: 
  727:     %% We now expect that the binary has been deallocated.
  728:     provoke_mem_leak(N-1, Code, Check).
  729: 
  730: create_binaries(Parent, NumRefs, Check) ->
  731:     Bin = literals:binary(),
  732:     Bins = lists:duplicate(NumRefs, Bin),
  733:     {bits,Bits} = literals:bits(),
  734:     Parent ! {started,self()},
  735:     receive
  736:         purged ->
  737:             %% The code has been purged. Now make sure that
  738:             %% the binaries haven't been corrupted.
  739:             Check = erlang:md5(Bin),
  740:             [Bin = B || B <- Bins],
  741:             <<42:13,Bin/binary>> = Bits,
  742: 
  743:             %% Remove all references to the binaries
  744:             %% Doing it explicitly like this ensures that
  745:             %% the binaries are gone when the parent process
  746:             %% receives the 'DOWN' message.
  747:             erlang:garbage_collect()
  748:     end.
  749: 
  750: wait_for_memory_deallocations() ->
  751:     try
  752:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, deallocations)
  753:     catch
  754:         error:undef ->
  755:             erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  756:             wait_for_memory_deallocations()
  757:     end.
  758: 
  759: fake_literals(_Config) ->
  760:     Mod = fake__literals__module,
  761:     try
  762:         do_fake_literals(Mod)
  763:     after
  764:         _ = code:purge(Mod),
  765:         _ = code:delete(Mod),
  766:         _ = code:purge(Mod),
  767:         _ = code:delete(Mod)
  768:     end,
  769:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  770:     ok.
  771: 
  772: do_fake_literals(Mod) ->
  773:     Tid = ets:new(test, []),
  774:     ExtTerms = get_external_terms(),
  775:     Term0 = {self(),make_ref(),Tid,fun() -> ok end,ExtTerms},
  776:     Terms = [begin
  777:                  make_literal_module(Mod, Term0),
  778:                  Mod:term()
  779:              end || _ <- lists:seq(1, 10)],
  780:     verify_lit_terms(Terms, Term0),
  781:     true = ets:delete(Tid),
  782:     ok.
  783: 
  784: make_literal_module(Mod, Term) ->
  785:     Exp = [{term,0}],
  786:     Attr = [],
  787:     Fs = [{function,term,0,2,
  788:            [{label,1},
  789:             {line,[]},
  790:             {func_info,{atom,Mod},{atom,term},0},
  791:             {label,2},
  792:             {move,{literal,Term},{x,0}},
  793:             return]}],
  794:     Asm = {Mod,Exp,Attr,Fs,3},
  795:     {ok,Mod,Beam} = compile:forms(Asm, [from_asm,binary,report]),
  796:     code:load_binary(Mod, atom_to_list(Mod), Beam).
  797: 
  798: verify_lit_terms([H|T], Term) ->
  799:     case H =:= Term of
  800:         true ->
  801:             verify_lit_terms(T, Term);
  802:         false ->
  803:             error({bad_term,H})
  804:     end;
  805: verify_lit_terms([], _) ->
  806:     ok.
  807: 
  808: get_external_terms() ->
  809:     {ok, Peer, Node}= ?CT_PEER(),
  810:     Ref = rpc:call(Node, erlang, make_ref, []),
  811:     Ports = rpc:call(Node, erlang, ports, []),
  812:     Pid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, self, []),
  813:     peer:stop(Peer),
  814:     {Ref,hd(Ports),Pid}.
  815: 
  816: %% OTP-7559: c_p->cp could contain garbage and create a false dependency
  817: %% to a module in a process. (Thanks to Richard Carlsson.)
  818: false_dependency(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  819:     run_sys_proc_test(fun false_dependency_test/1, Config).
  820: 
  821: false_dependency_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  822:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  823:     File = filename:join(Data, "cpbugx"),
  824:     {ok,cpbugx,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary,report]),
  825: 
  826:     do_false_dependency(fun cpbugx:before/0, Code),
  827:     do_false_dependency(fun cpbugx:before2/0, Code),
  828:     do_false_dependency(fun cpbugx:before3/0, Code),
  829: 
  830:     ok.
  831: 
  832: do_false_dependency(Init, Code) ->
  833:     {module,cpbugx} = erlang:load_module(cpbugx, Code),
  834: 
  835:     %% Spawn process. Make sure it has the appropriate init function
  836:     %% and returned. CP should not contain garbage after the return.
  837:     Parent = self(),
  838:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> false_dependency_loop(Parent, Init, true) end),
  839:     receive initialized -> ok end,
  840: 
  841:     %% Reload the module. Make sure the process is still alive.
  842:     {module,cpbugx} = erlang:load_module(cpbugx, Code),
  843:     io:put_chars(binary_to_list(element(2, process_info(Pid, backtrace)))),
  844:     true = is_process_alive(Pid),
  845: 
  846:     %% There should not be any dependency to cpbugx.
  847:     false = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, cpbugx),
  848: 
  849:     %% Kill the process and completely unload the code.
  850:     unlink(Pid), exit(Pid, kill),
  851:     true = erlang:purge_module(cpbugx),
  852:     true = erlang:delete_module(cpbugx),
  853:     true = erlang:purge_module(cpbugx),
  854:     ok.
  855: 
  856: false_dependency_loop(Parent, Init, SendInitAck) ->
  857:     Init(),
  858:     case SendInitAck of
  859:         true -> Parent ! initialized;
  860:         false -> void
  861:                  %% Just send one init-ack. I guess the point of this test
  862:                  %% wasn't to fill parents msg-queue (?). Seen to cause
  863:                  %% out-of-mem (on halfword-vm for some reason) by
  864:                  %% 91 million msg in queue. /sverker
  865:     end,
  866:     receive
  867:         _ -> false_dependency_loop(Parent, Init, false)
  868:     end.
  869: 
  870: coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  871:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:purge_module({a,b,c})),
  872:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:check_process_code(not_a_pid, ?MODULE)),
  873:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:check_process_code(self(), [not_a_module])),
  874:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:delete_module([a,b,c])),
  875:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:module_loaded(42)),
  876:     ok.
  877: 
  878: fun_confusion(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  879:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  880:     Src = filename:join(Data, "fun_confusion"),
  881:     Mod = fun_confusion,
  882: 
  883:     %% Load first version of module.
  884:     compile_load(Mod, Src, 1),
  885:     F1 = Mod:f(),
  886:     1 = F1(),
  887: 
  888:     %% Load second version of module.
  889:     compile_load(Mod, Src, 2),
  890:     F2 = Mod:f(),
  891: 
  892:     %% F1 should refer to the old code, not the newly loaded code.
  893:     1 = F1(),
  894:     2 = F2(),
  895:     ok.
  896: 
  897: compile_load(Mod, Src, Ver) ->
  898:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = compile:file(Src, [binary,{d,version,Ver}]),
  899:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "fun_confusion.beam", Code1),
  900:     ok.
  901: 
  902: 
  903: t_copy_literals(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  904:     run_sys_proc_test(fun t_copy_literals_test/1, Config).
  905: 
  906: t_copy_literals_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  907:     %% Compile the literals module.
  908:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  909:     File = filename:join(Data, "literals"),
  910:     {ok,literals,Code} = compile:file(File, [report,binary]),
  911:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  912: 
  913:     N   = 30,
  914:     Me  = self(),
  915:     %% reload literals code every 567 ms
  916:     Rel = spawn_link(fun() -> reloader(literals,Code,567) end),
  917:     %% add new literal msgs to the loop every 789 ms
  918:     Sat = spawn_link(fun() -> saturate(Me,789) end),
  919:     %% run for 10s
  920:     _   = spawn_link(fun() -> receive after 10000 -> Me ! done end end),
  921:     ok  = chase_msg(N, Me),
  922:     %% cleanup
  923:     Rel ! done,
  924:     Sat ! done,
  925:     %% Trap exit. We don't want to be killed if/when our spawned
  926:     %% processes fail when we remove the literals module...
  927:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  928:     catch erlang:purge_module(literals),
  929:     catch erlang:delete_module(literals),
  930:     catch erlang:purge_module(literals),
  931:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  932:     ok  = flush(),
  933:     ok.
  934: 
  935: -define(mod, t_copy_literals_frags).
  936: t_copy_literals_frags(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  937:     run_sys_proc_test(fun t_copy_literals_frags_test/1, Config).
  938: 
  939: t_copy_literals_frags_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  940:     Bin = gen_lit(?mod,[{a,{1,2,3,4,5,6,7}},
  941:                         {b,"hello world"},
  942:                         {c, <<"hello world">>},
  943:                         {d, {"hello world", {1.0, 2.0, <<"some">>, "string"}}},
  944:                         {e, <<"off heap", 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,
  945:                                           8, 9,10,11,12,13,14,15,
  946:                                           0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,
  947:                                           8, 9,10,11,12,13,14,15,
  948:                                           0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,
  949:                                           8, 9,10,11,12,13,14,15,
  950:                                           0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,
  951:                                           8, 9,10,11,12,13,14,15>>},
  952:                         {f, fun ?MODULE:all/0}]),
  953: 
  954:     {module, ?mod} = erlang:load_module(?mod, Bin),
  955:     N = 6000,
  956:     Recv = spawn_opt(fun() -> receive
  957:                                   read ->
  958:                                       io:format("reading"),
  959:                                       literal_receiver()
  960:                               end
  961:                      end, [link,{min_heap_size, 10000}]),
  962:     Switcher = spawn_link(fun() -> literal_switcher() end),
  963:     Pids = [spawn_opt(fun() -> receive
  964:                                    {Pid, go, Recv, N} ->
  965:                                        io:format("sender batch (~w) start ~w~n",[N,self()]),
  966:                                        literal_sender(N,Recv),
  967:                                        Pid ! {self(), ok}
  968:                                end
  969:                       end, [link,{min_heap_size,800}]) || _ <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  970:     _ = [Pid ! {self(), go, Recv, N} || Pid <- Pids],
  971:     %% don't read immediately
  972:     timer:sleep(5),
  973:     Recv ! read,
  974:     Switcher ! {switch,?mod,Bin,[Recv|Pids],200},
  975:     _ = [receive {Pid, ok} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  976:     Switcher ! {self(), done},
  977:     receive {Switcher, ok} -> ok end,
  978:     Recv ! {self(), done},
  979:     receive {Recv, ok} -> ok end,
  980:     catch erlang:purge_module(?mod),
  981:     catch erlang:delete_module(?mod),
  982:     catch erlang:purge_module(?mod),
  983:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  984:     ok.
  985: 
  986: literal_receiver() ->
  987:     receive
  988:         {Pid, done} ->
  989:             io:format("reader_done~n"),
  990:             Pid ! {self(), ok};
  991:         {_Pid, msg, [A,B,C,D,E]} ->
  992:             A = ?mod:a(),
  993:             B = ?mod:b(),
  994:             C = ?mod:c(),
  995:             D = ?mod:d(),
  996:             E = ?mod:e(),
  997:             F = ?mod:f(),
  998:             literal_receiver();
  999:         {Pid, sender_confirm} ->
 1000:             io:format("sender confirm ~w~n", [Pid]),
 1001:             Pid ! {self(), ok},
 1002:             literal_receiver()
 1003:     end.
 1004: 
 1005: literal_sender(0, Recv) ->
 1006:     Recv ! {self(), sender_confirm},
 1007:     receive {Recv, ok} -> ok end;
 1008: literal_sender(N, Recv) ->
 1009:     Recv ! {self(), msg, [?mod:a(),
 1010:                           ?mod:b(),
 1011:                           ?mod:c(),
 1012:                           ?mod:d(),
 1013:                           ?mod:e(),
 1014:                           ?mod:f()]},
 1015:     literal_sender(N - 1, Recv).
 1016: 
 1017: literal_switcher() ->
 1018:     receive
 1019:         {switch,Mod,Bin,Pids,Tmo} ->
 1020:             literal_switcher(Mod,Bin,Pids,Tmo)
 1021:     end.
 1022: literal_switcher(Mod,Bin,Pids,Tmo) ->
 1023:     receive
 1024:         {Pid,done} ->
 1025:             Pid ! {self(),ok}
 1026:     after Tmo ->
 1027:               io:format("load module ~w~n", [Mod]),
 1028:               {module, Mod} = erlang:load_module(Mod,Bin),
 1029:               ok = check_and_purge(Pids,Mod),
 1030:               io:format("purge complete ~w~n", [Mod]),
 1031:               literal_switcher(Mod,Bin,Pids,Tmo+Tmo)
 1032:     end.
 1033: 
 1034: check_and_purge([],Mod) ->
 1035:     erlang:purge_module(Mod),
 1036:     ok;
 1037: check_and_purge(Pids,Mod) ->
 1038:     io:format("purge ~w~n", [Mod]),
 1039:     Tag = make_ref(),
 1040:     _ = [begin
 1041:              erlang:check_process_code(Pid,Mod,[{async,{Tag,Pid}}])
 1042:          end || Pid <- Pids],
 1043:     Retry = check_and_purge_receive(Pids,Tag,[]),
 1044:     check_and_purge(Retry,Mod).
 1045: 
 1046: check_and_purge_receive([Pid|Pids],Tag,Retry) ->
 1047:     receive
 1048:         {check_process_code, {Tag, Pid}, false} ->
 1049:             check_and_purge_receive(Pids,Tag,Retry);
 1050:         {check_process_code, {Tag, Pid}, true} ->
 1051:             check_and_purge_receive(Pids,Tag,[Pid|Retry])
 1052:     end;
 1053: check_and_purge_receive([],_,Retry) ->
 1054:     Retry.
 1055: 
 1056: 
 1057: gen_lit(Module,Terms) ->
 1058:     FunStrings = [lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w() -> ~w.~n", [F,Term]))||{F,Term}<-Terms],
 1059:     FunForms = function_forms(FunStrings),
 1060:     Forms    = [{attribute,erl_anno:new(1),module,Module},
 1061:                 {attribute,erl_anno:new(2),export,[FA || {FA,_} <- FunForms]}] ++
 1062:                [Function || {_, Function} <- FunForms],
 1063:     {ok, Module, Bin} = compile:forms(Forms),
 1064:     Bin.
 1065: 
 1066: function_forms([]) -> [];
 1067: function_forms([S|Ss]) ->
 1068:     {ok, Ts,_} = erl_scan:string(S),
 1069:     {ok, Form} = erl_parse:parse_form(Ts),
 1070:     Fun   = element(3, Form),
 1071:     Arity = element(4, Form),
 1072:     [{{Fun,Arity}, Form}|function_forms(Ss)].
 1073: 
 1074: chase_msg(0, Pid) ->
 1075:     chase_loop(Pid);
 1076: chase_msg(N, Master) ->
 1077:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> chase_msg(N - 1,Master) end),
 1078:     chase_loop(Pid).
 1079: 
 1080: chase_loop(Pid) ->
 1081:     receive
 1082:         done ->
 1083:             Pid ! done,
 1084:             ok;
 1085:         {_From,Msg} ->
 1086:             Pid ! {self(), Msg},
 1087:             ok = traverse(Msg),
 1088:             chase_loop(Pid)
 1089:     end.
 1090: 
 1091: saturate(Pid,Time) ->
 1092:     Es = [msg1,msg2,msg3,msg4,msg5],
 1093:     Msg = [literals:E()||E <- Es],
 1094:     Pid ! {self(), Msg},
 1095:     receive
 1096:         done -> ok
 1097:     after Time ->
 1098:               saturate(Pid,Time)
 1099:     end.
 1100: 
 1101: traverse([]) -> ok;
 1102: traverse([H|T]) ->
 1103:     ok = traverse(H),
 1104:     traverse(T);
 1105: traverse(T) when is_tuple(T) -> ok;
 1106: traverse(B) when is_binary(B) -> ok;
 1107: traverse(I) when is_integer(I) -> ok;
 1108: traverse(#{ 1 := V1, b := V2 }) ->
 1109:     ok = traverse(V1),
 1110:     ok = traverse(V2),
 1111:     ok.
 1112: 
 1113: 
 1114: reloader(Mod,Code,Time) ->
 1115:     receive
 1116:         done -> ok
 1117:     after Time ->
 1118:               code:purge(Mod),
 1119:               {module,Mod} = erlang:load_module(Mod, Code),
 1120:               reloader(Mod,Code,Time)
 1121:     end.
 1122: 
 1123: erl_544(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1124:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1125:         utf8 ->
 1126:             {ok, CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1127:             try
 1128:                 Mod = erl_544,
 1129:                 FileName = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 1130:                 Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1131:                 Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1132:                 {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join(Data,
 1133:                                                                  FileName)),
 1134:                 Dir = filename:join(Priv, [16#2620,16#2620,16#2620]),
 1135:                 File = filename:join(Dir, FileName),
 1136:                 io:format("~ts~n", [File]),
 1137:                 ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1138:                 ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
 1139:                 ok = file:write_file(File, [FileContent]),
 1140:                 {ok, Mod} = compile:file(File),
 1141:                 Res1 = (catch Mod:err()),
 1142:                 io:format("~p~n", [Res1]),
 1143:                 {'EXIT', {err, [{Mod, err, 0, Info1}|_]}} = Res1,
 1144:                 File = proplists:get_value(file, Info1),
 1145:                 Me = self(),
 1146:                 Go = make_ref(),
 1147:                 Tester = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1148:                                             Mod:wait(Me, Go),
 1149:                                             Mod:err()
 1150:                                     end),
 1151:                 receive Go -> ok end,
 1152:                 Res2 = process_info(Tester, current_stacktrace),
 1153:                 io:format("~p~n", [Res2]),
 1154:                 {current_stacktrace, Stack} = Res2,
 1155:                 [{Mod, wait, 2, Info2}|_] = Stack,
 1156:                 File = proplists:get_value(file, Info2),
 1157:                 StackFun = fun(_, _, _) -> false end,
 1158:                 FormatFun = fun (Term, _) -> io_lib:format("~tp", [Term]) end,
 1159:                 Formatted =
 1160:                     erl_error:format_stacktrace(1, Stack, StackFun, FormatFun),
 1161:                 true = is_list(Formatted),
 1162:                 ok
 1163:             after
 1164:                 ok = file:set_cwd(CWD)
 1165:             end,
 1166:             ok;
 1167:         _Enc ->
 1168:             {skipped, "Only run when native file name encoding is utf8"}
 1169:     end.
 1170: 
 1171: %% Test that the copying of literals to a process during purging of
 1172: %% literals will cause the process to be killed if the max heap size
 1173: %% is exceeded.
 1174: max_heap_size(_Config) ->
 1175:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1176:     Value = [I || I <- lists:seq(1, 5000)],
 1177:     Code = gen_lit(Mod, [{term,Value}]),
 1178:     {module,Mod} = erlang:load_module(Mod, Code),
 1179:     SpawnOpts = [monitor,
 1180:                  {max_heap_size,
 1181:                   #{size=>1024,
 1182:                     kill=>true,
 1183:                     error_logger=>true}}],
 1184:     {Pid,Ref} = spawn_opt(fun() ->
 1185:                                   max_heap_size_proc(Mod)
 1186:                           end, SpawnOpts),
 1187:     receive
 1188:         {'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,Reason} ->
 1189:             killed = Reason;
 1190:         Other ->
 1191:             ct:fail({unexpected_message,Other})
 1192:     after 10000 ->
 1193:             ct:fail({process_did_not_die, Pid, erlang:process_info(Pid)})
 1194:     end.
 1195: 
 1196: max_heap_size_proc(Mod) ->
 1197:     Value = Mod:term(),
 1198:     code:delete(Mod),
 1199:     code:purge(Mod),
 1200:     receive
 1201:         _ -> Value
 1202:     end.
 1203: 
 1204: check_process_code_signal_order(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1205:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 1206:     process_flag(priority, high),
 1207:     {module,versions} = erlang:load_module(versions, compile_version(1, Config)),
 1208:     Pid = spawn_opt(versions, loop, [], [{scheduler, 1}]),
 1209:     true = erlang:delete_module(versions),
 1210:     true = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, versions),
 1211:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1212:     spam_signals(Pid, 10000),
 1213:     %% EXIT signal *should* arrive...
 1214:     exit(Pid, kill),
 1215:     %% ... before CPC signal...
 1216:     async = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, versions, [{async, Ref}]),
 1217:     %% ... which means that the result of the check_process_code *should* be 'false'...
 1218:     false = busy_wait_cpc_res(Ref),
 1219:     ok.
 1220: 
 1221: busy_wait_cpc_res(Ref) ->
 1222:     receive
 1223: 	{check_process_code, Ref, Res} ->
 1224: 	    Res
 1225:     after 0 ->
 1226: 	    busy_wait_cpc_res(Ref)
 1227:     end.
 1228: 
 1229: spam_signals(P, N) when N =< 0 ->
 1230:     ok;
 1231: spam_signals(P, N) ->
 1232:     link(P),
 1233:     unlink(P),
 1234:     spam_signals(P, N-2).
 1235: 
 1236: check_process_code_dirty_exec_proc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1237:     Pid = spawn(fun () ->
 1238: 			erts_debug:dirty_io(wait, 10000)
 1239: 		end),
 1240:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1241:     false = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, non_existing_module),
 1242:     {status, running} = process_info(Pid, status),
 1243:     exit(Pid, kill),
 1244:     false = is_process_alive(Pid),
 1245:     ok.
 1246: 
 1247: %% OTP-18016: When loading a module over itself, a race in fun loading made it
 1248: %% possible to call a local fun before the module was fully reloaded.
 1249: call_fun_before_load(Config) ->
 1250:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1251:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1252:     Path = code:get_path(),
 1253:     true = code:add_path(Priv),
 1254:     try
 1255:         SrcFile = filename:join(Data, "call_fun_before_load.erl"),
 1256:         ObjFile = filename:join(Priv, "call_fun_before_load.beam"),
 1257:         {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(SrcFile, [binary, report]),
 1258:         {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, ObjFile, Code),
 1259: 
 1260:         ok = call_fun_before_load:run(ObjFile, Code),
 1261: 
 1262:         code:purge(call_fun_before_load)
 1263:     after
 1264:         code:set_path(Path),
 1265:         code:delete(call_fun_before_load),
 1266:         code:purge(call_fun_before_load)
 1267:     end,
 1268:     ok.
 1269: 
 1270: %% Utilities.
 1271: 
 1272: make_sub_binary(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1273:     {_,B1} = split_binary(list_to_binary([0,1,3,Bin,4,5,6,7]), 3),
 1274:     {B,_} = split_binary(B1, size(Bin)),
 1275:     B;
 1276: make_sub_binary(List) ->
 1277:     make_sub_binary(list_to_binary(List)).
 1278: 
 1279: make_unaligned_sub_binary(Bin0) ->
 1280:     Bin1 = <<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>,
 1281:     Sz = size(Bin0),
 1282:     <<0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5>> = id(Bin1),
 1283:     Bin.
 1284: 
 1285: %% Add 1 bit to the size of the binary.
 1286: bit_sized_binary(Bin0) ->
 1287:     Bin = <<Bin0/binary,1:1>>,
 1288:     BitSize = bit_size(Bin),
 1289:     BitSize = 8*size(Bin) + 1,
 1290:     Bin.
 1291: 
 1292: flush() ->
 1293:     receive _ -> flush() after 0 -> ok end.
 1294: 
 1295: id(I) -> I.
 1296: 
 1297: 
 1298: run_sys_proc_test(Test, Config) ->
 1299:     OSRL = erlang:system_info(outstanding_system_requests_limit),
 1300:     
 1301:     TestLowOSRL = case OSRL < 10 of
 1302:                       true -> 1;
 1303:                       false -> 5
 1304:                   end,
 1305: 
 1306:     io:format("Running with the default outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [OSRL]),
 1307:     Res1 = Test(Config),
 1308:     io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res1]),
 1309:     try
 1310:         %% Run again with low limit and many processes...
 1311:         Procs = case erlang:system_info(process_limit) of
 1312:                     PLim when PLim < 20000 ->
 1313:                         erlang:system_info(process_limit) div 2;
 1314:                     _ ->
 1315:                         10000
 1316:                 end,
 1317:         erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, TestLowOSRL),
 1318:         io:format("Running with outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [TestLowOSRL]),
 1319:         Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1320:                                spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end)
 1321:                        end, lists:seq(1, Procs)),
 1322:         Res2 = Test(Config),
 1323:         lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1324:                               unlink(P),
 1325:                               exit(P, kill)
 1326:                       end, Ps),
 1327:         lists:foreach(fun (P) -> is_process_alive(P) end, Ps),
 1328:         io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res2]),
 1329:         {Res1, Res2}
 1330:     after
 1331:         TestLowOSRL = erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, OSRL)
 1332:     end.
